name: Asian Art-cultures Trivia Game | Art | 10 Questions

questions.text: Sir John Marshall dug out the earliest culture in the Indus Valley in the 1920's. What was the name of this culture?
questions.explanation:
Harappa.

	The Harappa or Mohenjo-daro culture was the earliest culture which exhibited art. These Harrapans-Hominidae evolved from the Java or Peking man 500,000 BCE.

questions.text: Which Pre-Shang city did the Bronze Age in China originate ca. 1600 B.C.E.?
questions.explanation:
erlitou.

	In the Xia Period, Erlitou was a city in the Henan Province between Luoyang and Zhenghzhou.

questions.text: Black Pottery shapes, e.g. the Gu Beaker, was derived ca.2000 B.C.E., from which Asian culture?
questions.explanation:
China.

	Longshan culture to be precise. In the Neolithic era, the Longshan culture intersected with Yangshao cultures.

questions.text: What area was the Bronze Age culture discovered in Thailand?
In the Bronze Age of China, the Ding and Four ram fang zun were used for what ceremonies?
questions.explanation:
wine and food.

	The Ding is a 3-legged Shang vessel used for wine.

questions.text: The Zhou period lasted until 771 B.C.E. in China. What motif describes the style of art prevalent during this time?
questions.explanation:
animal.

	The Zhou period was coined as Animal style by the late Sinologist Mikhail Rostovtzeff.

questions.text: Who described himself as 'Shi Huang Di', First Emperor of China ca. 200 B.C.E.?
questions.explanation:
Zheng.

	Zheng began the building of the Great Wall of China, and made many reforms, standardizations in measure currency, and set up the boring bureaucracy-style government.

questions.text: Which Dynasty existed concurrently during the Roman Empire?
Haniwa an ancient Japanese earthware ca. 3rd-6th BCE, depicts what object?
questions.explanation:
warrior in armor.

	Haniwa means circle of clay.These figurines were made in a circular style and used to guard tombs. Haniwa-style was used to emphasize substance, rather than form. And this style of thinking has pervaded the Japanese culture from these artworks.
